For each set piece equipped: attacks have +$S$% flanking attack power and injury chance for $S$ seconds after a dodge, and dodges have +$S$% stamina efficiency and graze damage reduction for $S$ seconds after an attack.
Injuries you inflict reduce enemy speed and damage by $S$%.
For each set piece equipped: $S$% of the Ethereal damage you deal permanently lowers enemy force, frost, fire, shock, and mental resistances. Can break damage immunities, but not status.
While inside a Yrden circle you have +$S$% increased time slow, +$S$% Vigor regeneration, and +$S$% Intensity for other Signs.
For each set piece equipped: perfect parries deal $S$% more poise damage, poise-breaking an enemy restores $S$ Stamina, and attacks against poise-broken enemies deal $S$% more damage.

Each point of current poise reduces enemy armor piercing by $S$% and damage taken through counters and parries by $S$%. Each point of missing poise increases attack speed by $S$% and poise damage by $S$%. Poise will not regenerate unless blocking or standing still.
For each set piece equipped: applying bleeding generates $S$ Adrenaline and each point of Adrenaline gained above $S$ restores $S$ Vitality and $S$ Stamina.
Maximum Adrenaline is increased to $S$. Bleed stacks reduce enemy force and frost resistance by $S$%.
For each set piece equipped: +$S$% ranged damage (including bombs) and +$S$% attack power per status effect on the target.
Effects that scale with Toxicity percent scale with flat Toxicity instead. +$S$% attack power and +$S$ Vitality regeneration per point of active Toxicity.
For each set piece equipped: critical hit chance is increased by $S$% for each poison stack on the target, and Axii applies up to $S$ poison stack on a successful cast.
You can apply an additional oil, and any potency loss from additional oils is reduced by $S$%. Each oil applied increases the bonus oil potency on critical hits by $S$%.
Enemies damaging you in melee have a chance to bleed.
Enemies slain in melee restore your Vitality by $S$ per bleed stack.
Enemies damaging you in melee have a chance to be stunned or become your puppet.
Axii removes all bleeding from the target to restore your Vitality by $S$ per bleed stack.
Strong attacks increase the damage of your next fast attack by $S$ and vice versa.

Attacking an opponent below $S$ health confers $S$ extra ethereal damage, while attacking opponents while you are below $S$ Vitality confers $S$ extra ethereal damage and +$S$ Adrenaline gain.
These effects can stack.
As Vitality falls below $S$, you deal up to $S$ more damage in melee.
A sturdy and convenient projectile weapon.

When Axii ends, targets lose $I$% of their maximum stamina and poise and are slowed for $I$ seconds.
These effects are reduced based on the maximum health of the target.

Critical hits fully restore Poise and heal an injury.
Critical damage is increased up to $S$% the more armor the target has. After $S$ seconds without attacking, your next attack has $S$% increased critical chance and armor piercing.
Your counters cost $S$% less poise. Hitting an enemy with less poise than you restores up to $S$ stamina.
Enemies hitting you in melee may be chilled. When attacking with a two-handed secondary weapon, you deal $S$% more damage and are immune to stagger.

All equipped Glyphs (including Glyphword components) provide additional bonuses.
Signs: +$S$% respective Sign Intensity

Binding: +$S$% Toxicity Drain
Warding: +$S$ Armor
Throwing knives stun opponents during their attacks. At night, total speed is increased by $S$% and dodge windows are lengthened.
Increases Firestream damage by $I$, Igni damage by $I$, and burn damage by $I$.

Increases Aard's poise damage by $I$%.
Increases stun chance to $I$%.

Chance increases against targets low in stamina or poise.

Quen regenerates $I$ of its health per second.

Aard applies up to $I$ bleed stacks.

+$I$ Aard damage

Aard permanently weakens enemy armor and force resistance by $I$%.

+$I$ Aard damage

Aard chill chance is increased by $I$%. If a target is both frozen and knocked down by Aard, it is instantly killed. Otherwise freeze deals an additional $I$ damage.

+$I$ Aard damage

Time slows by $I$% for $I$ seconds when dodging or casting Aard.

+$I$% Movespeed

Casting Aard while sprinting increases intensity by $I$% for each second sprinted. Movement speed bonuses increase Aard intensity.

+$I$% Movespeed

When time slows from dodging or casting Aard, your speed is offset.

+$I$% Movespeed

You are immune to burns. Above $I$ adrenaline your armor alights, burning enemies who strike you in melee.

+$I$% Adrenaline gain

You release a wave of flame when poisebroken, taking $I$% vitality in damage, or perfect parrying at full poise.

+$I$% Adrenaline gain

You continuously deal up to $I$ fire damage per point of adrenaline to nearby enemies.

+$I$% Adrenaline gain

Igni and burns reduce enemy morale, causing them to behave less aggressively in combat. Burns no longer increase enemy burn resistance.

+$I$ Igni damage

Enemies killed by Igni or while burning explode, dealing $I$ fire damage to nearby enemies.

+$I$ Igni damage

Burning an enemy restores $F$ vigor. Killing an enemy with Igni or while burning restores $F$ vigor.

+$I$ Igni damage

Enemies killed while in a Yrden ring restore your vitality and vigor based on their maximum health.

+$I$% Lifesteal

Enemies spending stamina while in a Yrden ring restore your stamina.

+$I$% Lifesteal

Enemies damaged while in a Yrden ring or by a Warding Glyph restore your vitality and vigor based on the damage dealt.

+$I$% Lifesteal

Enemies lose $I$% of their maximum stamina per second while in a Yrden ring, or $I$% when hit by a Warding Glyph.

Warding Glyph applies $I$ poison stacks

Enemies lose $F$% of their maximum vitality per second while in a Yrden ring, or $I$% when hit by a Warding Glyph.

Warding Glyph applies $I$ poison stacks

Armor maintenance buff increases your armor by $I$.

+$I$ Poise

Equipped armor does not suffer standard durability loss.

+$I$ Poise

Fatal damage is blocked at the cost of armor durability.

+$I$ Poise

Your armor deflects incoming arrows and bolts, preventing all damage.

+$I$ Armor

Your armor deflects any incoming attack, preventing all damage. This ability then goes on cooldown based on the damage prevented.

+$I$ Armor

Your armor deflects all incoming projectiles, preventing all damage.

+$I$ Armor

Stamina or vigor gained while at maximum restores vitality.

+$I$ Vitality regeneration

Vitality regeneration is increased by up to $I$% the lower your current vitality. The vitality restored from stamina and vigor is doubled when standing still.

+$I$ Vitality regeneration

You regenerate half the damage you take from an attack over $I$ seconds. Resets upon being hit.

+$I$ Vitality regeneration

Adrenaline generation is no longer reduced at high vitality.

+$I$ Vitality

At full vitality, $I$% of your vitality regeneration is added to stamina and vigor regeneration.

+$I$ Vitality

Killing an enemy while you are at full health grants charges that increases damage by $I$% and armor by $I$. You lose $I$ charge when hit and can have $I$ charges maximum.

+$I$ Vitality

Maximum carry weight is increased by $I$. Carrying more weight increases armor up to $I$ and stagger resistance up to $I$%.

+$I$% Secondary resistances

Being well-rested increases vigor regeneration by $I$%. Being well-fed increases stamina regeneration by $I$. Being well-hydrated increases toxicity drain by $I$%.

+$I$% Secondary resistances

Spend $I$ vigor to survive fatal damage at $I$ vitality. Penalties from low vitality are reduced by $I$%.

+$I$% Secondary resistances

Unless you meditate, toxicity will not drain without toxicity gain. Penalties from high toxicity are reduced by $I$%.

+$I$% Potion duration

Decoctions with power mutagens increase vitality regeneration by $I$. Decoctions with endurance mutagens increase stamina regeneration by $I$. Decoctions with concentration mutagens increase vigor regeneration by $I$%.

+$I$% Potion duration

Each source of toxicity gain increases mutagen effects and toxicity drain by $I$%.

+$I$% Potion duration

Maximum carry weight is increased by $I$. Carrying less weight increases total speed by up to $I$%.

-$I$% Armor penalties

Speed penalties from low stamina are decreased by up to $I$% based on current adrenaline.

-$I$% Armor penalties

The time slow from adrenaline is no longer reduced at high vitality.

-$I$% Armor penalties

Spend $I$ vigor to avoid Overexertion and restore $I$ stamina.

+$I$% Stamina efficiency

Stamina and poise regeneration is increased by $I$% when standing still.

+$I$% Stamina efficiency

Stamina costs are reduced by up to $I$% the higher your poise percentage. Poise costs are reduced by up to $I$% the lower your stamina percentage.

+$I$% Stamina efficiency

Perfect parries apply the chilled effect.

+$I$% Defense efficiency

Chilled enemies take poise damage when parried and cannot damage you through counters or parries.

+$I$% Defense efficiency

Chilled enemies have their poise regeneration lowered by $I$%. Melee poise-breaks freeze the target.

+$I$% Defense efficiency

Every $I$ points of frost damage dealt to a target lowers their stamina by $I$.

+$I$% Chance to chill

Chilled enemies are further slowed by up to $I$% the lower their current stamina.

+$I$% Chance to chill

This sword deals an additional $I$ frost damage for every point of stamina the target is missing.

+$I$% Chance to chill

This sword heats up when it strikes, gaining charges that increase fire damage by $I$. Cools down over time.

+$I$ Fire damage

Charges also increase critical chance by $I$% and offense efficiency by $I$%.

+$I$ Fire damage

Killing an enemy has a $I$% chance per charge to trigger an explosion that deals $I$ fire damage to nearby enemies. Critical hits have a $I$% chance per charge to do the same.

+$I$ Fire damage

Hitting a burning enemy with this sword increases burn duration by $F$ seconds. Interrupting a burn animation refreshes burn duration.

+$I$% Chance to burn

Enemies in a burn animation lose up to $I$% of their maximum poise each second. Burn damage increases by $I$ each second.

+$I$% Chance to burn

Enemies permanently take $I$% more damage for every second they have been burned.

+$I$% Chance to burn

Bombs convey the effects of oils on this sword. All oils additionally give a $I$% chance to poison.

+$I$ Poison damage

Poison damage is converted to physical damage if the target's poison resistance is higher than its armor.

+$I$ Poison damage

Oil effects are increased by $I$% for each poison stack on the target.

+$I$ Poison damage

This sword has $I$% additional poison chance for every $I$ points of active toxicity.

+$I$% Chance to poison

Removes the maximum limit on the number of poison stacks on a target.

+$I$% Chance to poison

Each poison stack on a target reduces their poison, bleeding, and injury resistance by $I$%. Poison damage over time deals $I$% more damage.

+$I$% Chance to poison

When you apply bleeding, there is a chance equal to the target's health percentage to apply $I$ additional stacks.

+$I$% Chance to cause bleeding

Removes the maximum limit on the number of bleed stacks on a target.

+$I$% Chance to cause bleeding

The first strike of a heavy special attack applies $I$ bleed stacks, then the second strike removes all bleed stacks on the target. Deals $I$ damage and increases the target's bleeding resistance by $I$% for each stack removed.

+$I$% Chance to cause bleeding

Your adrenaline cannot fall below $I$% of your missing vitality percentage.

+$I$ Adrenaline degeneration delay

To avoid Overexertion, you spend adrenaline instead of stamina.

+$I$ Adrenaline degeneration delay

You gain $F$% lifesteal for each point of adrenaline and $F$% lifesteal for each missing vitality percent.

+$I$ Adrenaline degeneration delay

The range of your slash counters is increased. Allows kick and bash counters against large creatures.

+$I$% Counter damage

Your counters deal $I$% more poise damage and return $I$% of the poise damage dealt.

+$I$% Counter damage

Countering with more precise timing increases your counter damage by $I$% of the countered attack's damage.

+$I$% Counter damage

Doubles chance to apply electroshock to $I$%. Electroshock also paralyzes the target.

+$I$ Shock damage

This sword deals up to $I$ additional shock damage based on the target's armor.

+$I$ Shock damage

Striking a shocked enemy with this sword charges it, granting $I$% Quen intensity and $I$% damage through blocks. Casting Quen discharges it, dealing $I$ shock damage per charge and shocking nearby enemies.

+$I$ Shock damage

Killing an enemy with Whirl or Rend restores $I$ stamina.

+$I$% Offense efficiency

Attacking increases attack speed and offense efficiency by $I$% until the next non-attack action.

+$I$% Offense efficiency

When reaching $I$ adrenaline, enter a state where time slows and actions have no stamina cost. Adrenaline drains quickly and effect ends when out of adrenaline.

+$I$% Offense efficiency

Attacks against enemies at full health deal $I$% more damage.

+$I$% Flanking attack power

Flanking attacks are guaranteed critical hits.

+$I$% Flanking attack power

The first attack after this sword is unsheathed or kills has +$I$% critical damage.

+$I$% Flanking attack power

Oils and effects on this sword have +$I$% duration.

+$I$% Vigor regeneration

Signs and sign effects have +$I$% duration.

+$I$% Vigor regeneration

This sword has increased attack range, and $I$% of damage it deals is repeated as additional ethereal damage.

+$I$% Vigor regeneration

This sword gains elemental damage and status effects from your currently selected sign, scaling with sign intensity.

+$I$% Sign intensity

Strong attacks will trigger the Warding Glyph to fire at the target.

+$I$% Sign intensity

Special attacks have a chance to trigger effects based on your currently selected sign. Rend scales with charge time, up to $I$%. Whirl has a $I$% chance per attack.

+$I$% Sign intensity

Attack power is increased by $F$% for every $I$ maximum hitpoints of current enemies. Poise damage is increased by $F$% per point of adrenaline.

+$I$% Stagger resistance while attacking

When fighting bosses, you have +$I$% stagger resistance, adrenaline drains $I$% slower, and your melee poisebreaks deal additional damage based on the target's maximum health.

+$I$% Stagger resistance while attacking

A fully charged Rend attack consumes all available vigor to deal up to $I$% additional damage with $I$% lifesteal.

+$I$% Stagger resistance while attacking

You deal an additional $I$% damage to staggered enemies.

+$I$% Chance to stagger

While above $I$% poise, your attacks deal $I$% more poise damage but you suffer $I$% of your maximum poise in recoil.

+$I$% Chance to stagger

While above $I$% vitality, your attacks deal $I$% more damage but you suffer $I$% of your maximum vitality in recoil.

+$I$% Chance to stagger

You can apply status effects through enemy blocks. If the target is not blocking, $I$% of block penetration is added to armor piercing.

+$I$% Damage through enemy blocks

Armor piercing above the target's armor value is added to critical damage.

+$I$% Damage through enemy blocks

Fast attacks reduce enemy armor by $I$% for $I$ seconds. Strong attacks reduce enemy armor by $I$% permanently.

+$I$% Damage through enemy blocks

Weapon repair buffs improve armor piercing by $I$%.

-$I$% Damage taken through blocks

This sword does not suffer standard durability loss.

-$I$% Damage taken through blocks

Enemies killed with this sword permanently increase its damage. Killing $I$ maximum hitpoints will increase its damage by $I$.

-$I$% Damage taken through blocks

Injuries reduce the target's armor piercing by $I$% and increase the duration of bleed stacks by $I$%.

+$I$% Chance to cause injuries

Finishers and dismemberments grant $I$% more stamina and adrenaline and cause $I$% more morale damage.

+$I$% Chance to cause injuries

Injuries deal $I$% of the target's maximum health in damage and reduce their maximum poise by $I$%.

+$I$% Chance to cause injuries

Critical chance is increased up to $I$% based on the difference between you and your target's health percentage.

+$I$% Critical damage

Damaging an enemy with a strong/fast attack permanently increases critical chance/critical damage against them by $I$% respectively.

+$I$% Critical damage

If a strong attack poisebreak is a critical hit, the target is instantly slain. Fast attack poisebreaks have +$I$% critical damage.

+$I$% Critical damage
Applying bleeding increases your total speed by 15% for 3 seconds. Melee attacks deal 2% more damage for each bleeding stack on the target.
Killing an enemy restores 10% of your missing vitality. Adrenaline degeneration is delayed by 2 additional seconds.
You cannot be poisebroken. Receiving damage increases damage and stagger resistance by 5% for 5 seconds, up to 25%.

At night your total speed, attack power, stamina efficiency, and sign intensity are increased by 10%. During a full moon, taking fatal damage will remove this decoction and return you to 50% vitality.
Dealing elemental damage reduces enemy resistance to every other type of elemental damage. Fist attacks deal increased damage and have a chance to apply status effects.
Physical resistances are increased by 20% and you take no graze damage while dodging. Your melee attacks deal normal damage to incorporeal spectres.
You gain 20% vigor regen at dawn and up to 20% sign intensity at high vitality. You gain 2 stamina regen at dusk and up to 20% armor piercing at low vitality.

Using fast attacks, strong attacks, or signs generate stacks that can improve the strength of the other two. When reaching 6 stacks, the next use has 50% increased attack power or sign intensity. Fast attacks generate 1 stack, strong attacks 2 stacks, and signs 3 stacks.
Attack speed and power are increased by 10% for 2 seconds after performing a dodge. When calculating penalties from low stamina or vigor, you use the higher of the two.
Poison does not weaken you. Applying poison to enemies reduces your toxicity by 1. Opponents who cause you to bleed are poisoned.

You sell items for 25% more coin.
Haggling over contracts is 25% easier.
If your toxicity meter fills completely, you'll take poison damage from your toxicity gain and enter a fevered state with lowered speed and stamina regeneration. Drink a White Honey to recover.
Heavier armor will absorb more damage and increase your maximum poise, but you pay for that protection in slower speed, lower stamina regeneration, and higher stamina costs.
Attacks from behind have 15% higher critical chance and 10% higher damage. Parrying attacks from behind will cost additional poise without the Heightened Senses skill - so watch your rear.
Improving your equipment at a grindstone or repair bench will slow its durability loss by 50%.
Use repair kits to keep your equipment in good condition. They repair a portion of missing durability, so the longer you wait to use them the greater their effect.
Craftsmen can remove runes and upgrades from your items and return them to you.
Disassembling an item will recover any upgrades within, but they can be removed directly without the need to destroy the item.
Enemies with white health bars take little damage from steel swords. Switch to your silver blade, or coat your steel with Argentia oil.
Enemies with red health bars can be fought with either sword. Witchers with deep pockets will find silver ideal against monsters, while steel is best against humans and beasts.
You can Fast Travel to a harbor while on a boat by pulling up the World Map. Look for boats along the coast and near harbors.
Monster nests can be destroyed with a Dancing Star, Grapeshot or Samum bomb. But consider using the Igni sign instead.
With witcher gear, crafting it is only the first step. Upgrading it will subtly change its stats as well as its appearance.
The weather affects your enemies. You will find it easier to burn foes during the day, but harder during rain or storms.
The weather affects your enemies. Necrophages are more dangerous opponents at dusk or during the night. Grave hags are especially comfortable at this hour.
The weather affects your enemies. Werewolves are more dangerous at night, and particularly during a full moon. Even regular wolves move more swiftly under a full moon.
The weather affects your enemies. You will find Archespores more resilient in the sun.
The weather affects your enemies. Drowners and Sirens love rain and storms, but Harpies find it difficult to maneuver.
The weather affects your enemies. Whenever possible, fight noonwraiths under the moon and nightwraiths under the sun.
The weather affects your enemies. Wielders of magic - such as Sorceresses or Succubi - gain additional power under the moon, especially when full.
Destroyed monster nests are a good source of mutagens, unique monster parts, and even expensive jewelry.
If you're looking to make monster decoctions, merchants who specialize in books may have the uncommon knowledge you seek.
When you find a relic blade, it may be in unusable condition. You will need the services of a master weaponsmith to restore it.
Potions, bombs, and oils have high-quality forms that you can make by using high-quality ingredients. Potions can have secondary effects as well.
Every alchemy item requires a base ingredient. Alcohol for potions, animal fat for oils, and saltpetre for bombs are good starting points.
Every Sign has an alternate mode, accessible by holding the cast button.
You can perform alchemy by meditating at a fire or when visiting an alchemist or herbalist.
If you have sustained a lingering injury, you can treat it immediately with a bandage. They will also heal on their own when meditating at full health.
You can use Quen to protect yourself from the life-draining aura of a noonwraith or nightwraith. Argentia oil will also temporarily disable it.
When attempting to brew a superior alchemical item, every ingredient must be of pure quality. With the Alchemical Refinement perk, one ingredient can be of lower quality.
Witchers' reflexes are so sharp that a sword is enough defense to swat arrows out of the air as they fly. With proper timing, they can even reflected back to their point of origin.
Most opponents have limited stamina, and without it they deal less damage. You can deplete stamina with Aard or Paralysis oil, and attacking them will delay their stamina regeneration.
The Axii Sign is useful outside of combat. It can keep neutral animals from fleeing, calm horses, and even be used during dialogue.
While underwater, you cannot draw your swords or cast most Signs. Rely on Aard or your crossbow to deal with underwater attackers.
Be careful with your vigor. Each point increases your damage by 10%, and Signs cast with less than full vigor are weaker. Still, the right Sign at the right time can be worth the cost.
You can store weapons and armor in a number of stashes throughout the world. Gear stored in one location will be available in all other locations as well.
Look for a Runewright east of Novigraad to enchant your gear, but consider saving up first - in runes, glyphs, and especially coin.
When it comes to repairing armor, you need the right tools. Light, medium, and heavy armor all have their own specific repair kits.

Freeze your opponents solid. By combining two different sources of the chilled effect - for instance, Northern Wind bombs and Aard with the Frostbite skill - the enemy will be frozen in place and take additional damage.

If you find yourself doing very little damage to a foe, you may need more armor penetration. Use strong or counterattacks, Corrosive oil, bombs with the Riving Blast skill, or craft a new specialized weapon for these opponents.
Critical hits are not only a source of extra damage. They also increase armor penetration and the effects of any oils by 50%.
If you hear Geralt telling you to look around some, it means an artifact sword is somewhere nearby. You can disable these comments in Options > Mods > W3EE > Exploration.
Poisoned enemies move slower and do less damage. Bleeding enemies are slower to recover stamina and take additional bleed damage while low on stamina.
If you find yourself dying from toxicity without a White Honey at hand, meditating can save your life.
Attacking an enemy under the influence of Axii will make it more difficult to use Axii on them again.

Looking for the best place to offload your trophies? General merchants and innkeeps are a good place to start. They pay a higher price in Skellige, but merchants in Novigraad have deeper pockets. Toussaint has the best of both.
White Honey will immediately cure toxicity fever and reduce toxicity, but will also cancel the effects of other potions. Try to always have one at the ready.
You can customize the attributes of some gear before crafting. Putting your preferred attributes on a sword can tide you over until you can afford expensive artifact blades.
Struggling with ranged opponents? Try casting alternate Yrden before engaging. It offers a reliable zone of protection while you deal with any melee attackers.
Try creating your own alchemy bases from ingredients you already have. The savings might start small, but they add up over time.
When brewing an enhanced quality alchemical item, a pure ingredient can offset the inclusion of a contaminated one.

Do your saddlebags resemble an alchemical warehouse? Brewing beyond your immediate need can raise your skills. Distilling heavy ingredients or those without secondary effects into primary essences can save weight.
Struggling with an unfamiliar enemy? The Blizzard potion can help you come to grips with its behavior and pattern of attack.

You can perform a perfect parry by countering without holding any distance modifiers. It lowers your poise costs while staggering the attacker and reducing their poise, and can be used at lower poise levels than counterattacks as well.
When it comes to elemental damage, fire and frost have strong and weak matchups. Ethereal and shock damage are more versatile.
In order to maintain your adrenaline you need to generate some every 4 seconds, otherwise it begins to drain. Try to keep an even tempo in combat.

Increases bomb fuse time by $I$ seconds.

Increases bomb weight by $F$ and reduces throw range by $I$%.

Bombs detonate into a number of explosive fragments on impact, each doing $I$% of the damage of the original bomb.
Number of fragments: $I$
Increases bomb weight by $F$ and reduces throw range by $I$%.
Enables the creation of handheld bombs that explode after a brief delay or when exposed to fire.

When throwing a bomb or shooting a crossbow bolt, you can either use auto-aim for a quick attack, or aim manually for more precision. Manually aiming a bomb will reduce the delay between impact and detonation.
For new players looking for a more forgiving adventure.
The intended experience, with no modifiers for or against you.
For mod veterans and established playthroughs wanting more challenge.
For masters and masochists craving an unfair level of adversity.
Ranged attacks have $S$% higher critical chance and deal $S$% more poise damage. Dodges and rolls do not impede poise regeneneration.
Random herbs are found on slain enemies. Poise cannot be lowered for $S$ seconds after a dodge, roll, or long distance attack.
When you reduce an enemy's physical resistance, their armor piercing is reduced by the same amount. At Dusk your Stamina, Poise, and Vigor regeneration are increased by $S$%.
The Riving Blasts skill is not limited to the first bomb. While Albedo dominance is in effect, oils lose charge and equipment loses durability $S$% slower.

Slows Adrenaline degeneration by $I$%.
Increases critical chance by $F$% for each point of Vigor.
Counters and perfect parries will not reduce poise below $I$% of maximum.
For each set piece equipped: $S$% of Adrenaline gained restores Vigor and while at full Vigor, $S$% of Vigor regeneration is added to Stamina regeneration.
Casting Signs generates $S$ Adrenaline. Potions imbibed with no other potions active have their effects increased by $S$%. Decoction passive effects are increased by $S$%.

Adrenaline gain is increased by 50%.
Adrenaline no longer degenerates.
Being hit will remove Adrenaline instead of adding it.

You no longer suffer any penalties to speed or damage from low Stamina.
When taking damage you lose $S$ Stamina per percentage point of Vitality lost.
You take up to $S$% additional damage based on your missing Stamina.

Your toxicity level no longer drains except when meditating.
Spending Stamina and gaining Adrenaline will remove Toxicity based on your normal drain rate.
Per point of Stamina spent: $S$ seconds worth of drain
Per point of Adrenaline gained: $S$ seconds worth of drain

You deal $S$% more Poise damage with ranged attacks against attacking or incapacitated targets.
You deal up to $S$% more damage with ranged attacks based on the target's missing Poise.
Your Defense Efficiency is reduced by $S$%.

You no longer regenerate Vitality except when meditating.
Damaging enemies that have recently damaged you will restore some of your lost Vitality based on the damage you dealt. Bonuses to Vitality Regeneration will increase the window you have to strike back.

Stamina costs of defensive actions are paid with Poise.
You always avoid hit reaction when your Poise percentage is higher than the percent of Vitality lost.
You can be poisebroken by unblocked attacks.

Melee damage is increased by $S$%.
Poise costs are reduced by $S$%.
Stamina costs of actions are reduced by $S$%.
Sign costs are increased by $S$%.

You can fully dodge attacks you are not normally able to, but when you do you incur additional Stamina and Poise costs.
Stamina regen delays after dodges are doubled.
You can no longer dodge while Overexerted.

Potions and Decoctions are no longer consumed when used.
White Honey no longer affects you.
Gain the effects of all researched mutations.

Blue - increases Vigor regeneration by 25%

To throw a bomb, press <>

You can also aim prior to throwing to increase your accuracy. To do this, hold <> and aim. Then release <> to throw the bomb.

Bombs have a 5 second fuse time before they detonate. This delay can be influenced by severeal means.

First, the fuse will be automatically shortened while you are manually aiming a bomb. A bomb is fully "primed" after 5 real-time seconds and will explode on impact, indicated by the held bomb beginning to spark. Bombs will not detonate prematurely.

Second, if Igni is your currently selected sign and a bomb has more than 1 second fuse time remaining, you will automatically spend 0.5 Vigor to cause it to detonate on impact.

Third, bombs will immediately explode if exposed to any of the following:
- Igni
- Aard
- Explosive bolts
- Fire damage from other bomb explosions
- A target with the Burning status condition.

To destroy a monster nest, strike it with the Igni sign.

You can also use a Grapeshot, Samum or Dancing Star bomb.
You can remove upgrades and runestones from your items here.

Once you select an item, you will be shown which upgrades it is fitted with here.

Bear in mind, however, that once you confirm your selection, all of this item's upgrades will be removed.
To remove upgrades, select an item and press <<GUI_Select>>
To remove upgrades and runestones, select an item and press <<GUI_PC_Select>>
You can get Temerian gear by helping Vernon Roche in eastern Novigraad.
You can get Nilfgaardian gear by working with Nilfgaardians throughout Velen. It can also be purchased from quartermaster Eggebracht at the Nilfgaardian army camp.
New Game+ is not supported in Enhanced Edition Redux.
You can get Skellige gear by helping Yoana at Crow's Perch.
Acquire crowns for the Ofieri runewright.
Give crowns to the Ofieri runewright.

Mutations are a further way to personalize your experience on the Path and customize your particular playstyle. They significantly alter core gameplay mechanics and player resources, offering both powerful advantages and debilitating drawbacks.

Mutations can be unlocked in any order you wish.

Developing a mutation requires a sizeable investment of greater colored mutagens, though there are several means of reducing their cost. When researching a red, blue, or green mutation you can provide a base mutagen that matches that mutation family. Any monster mutagen will suffice, but sourcing a higher tier archmutagen will provide further savings. This base mutagen is not consumed during research.

The cost of a mutation is also reduced by 10% for each connected mutation already researched.

Finally the Acclimation skill will also reduce research costs.

Mutant Mastery is a passive ability that develops automatically as you finish research on mutations.

This mutation has several stages, each boosting your experience gain in the Mutations and Trials of the Grasses skill trees. There are 4 total stages unlocked at two, four, eight, and twelve researched mutations.

Additionally, if you manage to gain access to an advanced laboratory dealing with Witcher mutations, this ability will gain further bonuses based on the color of your equipped mutation.

Blue: +25% Vigor Regeneration
Green: +50% Toxicity Drain
Red: +20 Vitality Regeneration
Orange: +20% Stamina Regeneration

In Enhanced Edition Redux, mutations are available from the start of the game.

Mutations significantly alter core game mechanics and player resources, offering both powerful advantages and debilitating drawbacks.

To learn more, open the Character Panel.
Once again, any mutation can be researched first regardless of its position. For tutorial purposes, select one of the highlighted mutations.
Once a mutation is researched, it will reduce the resarch cost of all connected mutations by 10%. The <font color="#CD7D03">Acclimation</font> skill will also reduce the required number.

<font color="#CD7D03">Mutant Mastery</font> is a passive ability that improves automatically as you develop other mutations. It will also gain additional benefits when you gain access to an advanced laboratory during <font color="#CD7D03">Turn and Face the Strange</font>.

Congratulations!
Your Mutant Mastery has advanced to the next level!

Mutations require <font color="#CD7D03">greater colored mutagens</font>. Red, blue, and green mutations can be made cheaper by possessing a monster mutagen or archmutagen of the correct family to use as a <font color="#CD7D03">base</font>. Return here with enough mutagens to unlock a mutation.

To use mutations, first you must research them. In Enhanced Edition Redux, mutations can be researched in <font color="#CD7D03">any order</font>. However, to advance this tutorial, select one of the highlighted mutations.

Mutations require <font color="#CD7D03">greater colored mutagens</font>. Red, blue, and green mutations can be made cheaper by possessing a monster mutagen or archmutagen of the correct family to use as a <font color="#CD7D03">base</font>. This base mutagen is not consumed.
You can get the Thousand Flowers set by helping elves throughout Velen and Novigraad. It can also be purchased at the Scoia'tael camp southwest of Novigraad.
You can get the White Tiger of the West set by scavenging the shipwreck Spoils of War throughout the Skellige Isles.
You can get the White Tiger of the West set by scavenging the shipwreck Spoils of War throughout the Skellige Isles.
